intro: Coleus tricholobus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, red, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Coleus tricholobus thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
